intro: Omalotheca afghanica, commonly known as the Afghan thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, including Afghanistan and Pakistan. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its spiny stems and showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically green when unripe and turn red when mature. Omalotheca afghanica is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and medicinal research.
